title: Deploy TC to the Play Store
body:
Translation Cards is no longer available on the Play Store. Look into why this has happened and re-deploy the app.

Add @IzzySoft [F-Droid compatible repo](https://apt.izzysoft.de/fdroid/index/apk/org.mercycorps.translationcards) to list of where to get Translation Cards.

title: Have the ability to run the Appium functional tests locally and through the pipeline
body: Currently the Appium tests are set up to run through the pipeline.  It would be useful to have a feature that would allow the user to toggle between running the tests locally or from the pipeline.

title: Appium Tests:  Unable to find the element id for the record button
body: For the create deck workflow, Appium is unable to locate the record button by id.

title: Unable to import file from downloads
body: The file that is being imported has an extension of *.txc####.

title: MyDeckAdapter & MyDeckItem -> MVP pattern
Not able to import deck with file name with.zip (Austin.s.Test.Deck.zip)
body:
1. Try to import a deck with file name Austin.s.Test.Deck.2.zip (https://github.com/translation-cards/translation-cards/files/493640/Austin.s.Test.Deck.2.zip)
2. Observed that not able to import the file named *.zip.
   (this file is referred in the issue #297)

title: MyDecksActivity to MVP pattern
Extract next button into view class
body: Currently we do a lot of redundant styling around the next button. Extract this view logic into a view class.

title: Translations should be created if they do not exist when editing a translation
body:
**Context**
When editing a translation in a deck that does not contain that translation for all languages, new translations are not created for the languages that do not contain the original translation.

**To Reproduce**
1. Import [Austin.s.Test.Deck.2.zip](https://github.com/translation-cards/translation-cards/files/493640/Austin.s.Test.Deck.2.zip)
2. Edit one of the translations in the deck
3. A new translation is not created for the languages that did not have the translation that was edited.

title: Upgrade to build target to Android N
body: We are not currently targeting the highest known Android SDK version. We should upgrade our application to target Android N so we can catch any bugs that may arise when using our app on Android N. With this, we should look into using the jack compiler to enable Java 8 language features.

title: Make Deck:  Have progress bar (Next tool bar) accessible while soft keyboard is displayed
body:
Having the progress bar (Next tool bar) accessible with the soft keyboard upon creating a new deck / adding a new card would make the functional tests more stable.

Please note that in an earlier build that this was implemented inconsistently in the app, however in the latest build it seems like this feature has been completely removed.

title: Persist language tab on translation card edit
body:
Needs Analysis:

Currently when you edit a translation card, the user will be entered into the edit flow in the first language of a deck regardless of the language they edited the card from.

title: Refactor ImportActivity
body: ImportActivity is not currently tested and is getting a bit cluttered.

title: Request Translation Button
body:
As a field worker
I want to be able to request a translation
So that I can continue to use the app
And it continues to meet my needs

title: Run End-to-End tests on the Pipeline
body:
To use our Espresso end-to-end test to its full potential, we need to be able to run it on the pipeline.

@PatrickDale and I have attempted to do this before, so talk to us before you pick up this card.

title: App crashes during DB migration
body:
After checking out 301c964, my app crashes on startup. Some of my ISO codes are stored as "INVALID" (rather than the expected "xx" or `null`), and `DatabaseHelper.updateInvalidIso()` doesn't fix it correctly.

Since 2142f2fcc6f6224f6fa40aee152b591ef1972b88, `LanguageService.getIsoForLanguage` would return "INVALID" for an invalid mapping, but it was changed to return "xx" in 613037284bb35196b2e30778b72b157563cb66c9. The former commit made it into production but the latter didn't, so it's possible that this could affect users that got the most recent update.

However, I think this only arose for me because I temporarily added some fake languages to my language mappings and created decks with them. The crash would only happen to users who managed to save a deck with an invalid language mapping, which I don't think is possible through normal use of the app. 

```
java.lang.RuntimeException: Unable to create application com.android.tools.fd.runtime.BootstrapApplication: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Empty values
   at android.app.ActivityThread.handleBindApplication(ActivityThread.java:4710)
   at android.app.ActivityThread.-wrap1(ActivityThread.java)
   at android.app.ActivityThread$H.handleMessage(ActivityThread.java:1405)
   at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:102)
   at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:148)
   at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:5417)
   at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Native Method)
   at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(ZygoteInit.java:726)
   at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:616)
  Caused by: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Empty values
   at android.database.sqlite.SQLiteDatabase.updateWithOnConflict(SQLiteDatabase.java:1542)
   at android.database.sqlite.SQLiteDatabase.update(SQLiteDatabase.java:1522)
   at org.mercycorps.translationcards.model.DatabaseHelper.updateEmptyOrInvalidLabelAndIsoCodes(DatabaseHelper.java:197)
   at org.mercycorps.translationcards.model.DatabaseHelper.onUpgrade(DatabaseHelper.java:162)
   at android.database.sqlite.SQLiteOpenHelper.getDatabaseLocked(SQLiteOpenHelper.java:256)
   at android.database.sqlite.SQLiteOpenHelper.getReadableDatabase(SQLiteOpenHelper.java:187)
   at org.mercycorps.translationcards.repository.DeckRepository.retrieveKeyForDeckWithExternalId(DeckRepository.java:122)
   at org.mercycorps.translationcards.MainApplication.checkForBundledDeckAndLoad(MainApplication.java:98)
   at org.mercycorps.translationcards.MainApplication.onCreate(MainApplication.java:70)
   at com.android.tools.fd.runtime.BootstrapApplication.onCreate(BootstrapApplication.java:369)
   at android.app.Instrumentation.callApplicationOnCreate(Instrumentation.java:1013)
   at android.app.ActivityThread.handleBindApplication(ActivityThread.java:4707)
```

title: Lines of Translation Text Sporadically Disappear in Deck View
body: This issue was reported by Zaina Hawi zainahawi@gmail.com at the Hackathon in the SF office. She noticed that occasionally when you view a deck in the application that the translation text gets truncated. The issue does not occur consistently but she was able to reproduce the issue sporadically a number of times. Below are steps to reproduce, and screenshots of cards where she observed the the issue: 1- Open one of the long statements 2- Arabic\Farsi\Pashto translation missing > QF Click Back 3- Click to view the deck again 4- Go to the statement > Translated statement will appear in full. (No missing elements) 5- Please check the screenshots below of the bug for all languages.

title: Progress bar display on Play button press RecordAudioActivity
body:
As an aid worker
Given I am adding a new translation and have recorded audio on the record audio screen
When I press the play audio button
Then I want to see the progress bar above the translation
So that I can see the progress of my playback
- [ ] When I press the play audio button the audio translation plays along with the progress bar
- [ ] If the audio is playing when I press the play button, the audio and the progress bar restart
- [ ] If I press the record button when the audio is playing the progress bar and the audio stop and it starts recording

*\* Currently on the record audio screen if you press on the translation card it will play the recording with the progress bar, however if you use the play audio button it will only play the translation without displaying the progress bar

title: Move anything relating to DB operations to repositories
body:
- Use the services exclusively to access repositories (or at least as much as makes sense)
- Most of these calls will be found through model objects.

title: Refactor AbstractTranslationCardsActivity
body:
- Move bitmap logic to a service
- Move any db calls to a service
- Make sure steps in oncreate are used in all extended activities. If not, move to a service.

title: Refactor AddTranslationActivity
body:
- [ ] setBitmapsForActivity moved to a bitmap service
- [x] showToast moved to some UIService
- [ ] Use dependency injection for objects received through application.
- [ ] LanguageTabsFragment logic move to service

title: Refactor AddNewTranslationContext
body:
Refactor NewDeckContext to use a builder pattern, and instantiate the NewTranslation in the Summary Activity.
Remove the responsibility for saving the Translation from the Context, and instead make calls to the translation service from the containing Activity or Service.

title: Refactor NewDeckContext
body: Refactor NewDeckContext to use a builder pattern, and instantiate the new Deck in the Review and Save Activity.

title: Add Translation: Extract Footer Object
body:
The navigation bar in the footer of the Add Translation flow can be extracted into a widget. This allows us to reuse it rather than adding every component of it to each layout in the flow.

If possible, the footer in this flow and the one described in #260 should use the same component.

title: Add Translation: Extract Header Object
body: The activities in the Add Translation flow have the same general layout: A picture, a screen title, and instructional text. These can be pulled into a widget, and reused across the flow, rather than declaring them in each layout.

title: Deck Creation: Extract Header Object
body: The activities in the New Deck flow have the same general layout: A picture, a screen title, and instructional text. These can be pulled into a widget, and reused across the flow, rather than declaring them in each layout.

title: Deck Creation: Extract Footer Object
body: The navigation bar in the footer of the New Deck flow can be extracted into a widget. This allows us to reuse it rather than adding every component of it to each layout in the flow.

title: Appium Proof of Concept For End-to-End Tests
body: We are deciding to migrate to a new framework for functional testing to gain the ability to leave our application for testing things like import/export of decks. Create a single assertion functional test using Calabash or Appium. Add this test to a functional test stage in our build pipeline.

title: Feature toggling
body: Find a feature toggling framework to use in order to enable a single branch workflow in git.

title: Configure pipeline to deploy to app hosting repositories
body:
We currently only deploy to an S3 bucket that is distributed as a "pre release" version of the app.

There are tools that can help manage mobile app environments making distribution and versioing for CI, QA, Staging, etc... easy. Some tools to look into in this space include fastlane and HockeyApp.

Investigate how we could start adopting these tools to make distribution to various project team members and stakeholders more manageable.
